title: Maya Le Tissier wins Man United Women Player of the Month award - Man United News And Transfer News
body_text:
Manchester United Women captain Maya Le Tissier scooped the final Player of the Month award.
Le Tissier was named the skipper of Marc Skinnerâ€™s side last pre-season after the departure of Katie Zelem.
The 23 year old has become a key player this season for club and country, making 95 appearances since joining from Brighton and Hove Albion in 2022.
The United star made such an impression this season that she was nominated for the leagueâ€™s Player of the Season award but lost out to Arsenalâ€™s Mariona Caldentey.
Her fine form also saw her inclusion in the Barclays Womenâ€™s Super League Team of the Season, alongside teammates Phallon Tullis-Joyce and Grace Clinton.
The skipper has now received another award as she was named the teamâ€™s best player in the final month of the season according to the clubâ€™s official website.
She doesn't miss a minute.
Our captain, @MayaLeTissier is deservedly your Player of the Month for May ğŸ…ğŸ’ª#MUWomen || @EsteeLauder
â€” Manchester United Women (@ManUtdWomen) May 31, 2025
She played in all three matches in May and beat competition from Leah Galton, Hinata Miyazawa and Grace Clinton.
Le Tissier started in crucial league fixtures against Manchester City and Arsenal, as well as Chelsea in the FA Cup final.
United secured Champions League football with a 2-2 draw against City at Old Trafford.
The captain scored a penalty in the 3-4 defeat to European champions Arsenal and lost out in the cup final 0-3 to Chelsea.
Le Tissier also played a key role in United Womenâ€™s participation in the World Sevens tournament in Estoril, where they reached the final.
She has also made an impression off the pitch, recently being awarded the clubâ€™s PFA Community Champion award alongside Amad.
